sense.name: accidental hole in a structure that lets substance escape
sense.examples: The leak was a four-inch hole in the side of the boat's hull. He checked all the pipes for leaks and found none. The surgery will repair a small leak in the patient's heart.

sense.name: the outflow or leakage from a breach or hole
sense.examples: We smelled a gas leak in the basement. There was a leak of oil training behind the car as it went up the street.

sense.name: unauthorized disclosure of confidential information
sense.examples: They were unsuccessful in preventing leaks to the press. The administration has not identified the source of the leak. The leak of military secrets to hostile nations is a real concern.

sense.name: the act of urination
sense.examples: He went into the bushes to take a leak. Some of the elderly experience uncontrolled bladder leaks.

sense.name: watery rot on produce caused by fungus
sense.examples: The lettuce had to be discarded because of leak.
